this game is challenging enough to keep you engaged and the story is pretty interesting you have to pay attention to all of the logs and watcher stones to really understand the story but its worth doing imo allinall the game keeps you wanting more the longer you play until you find out the full story there are 2 endings i believe only 2 so you can either look one up or play through twice i 100 recommend this game even though it is short

a nifty puzzle platformer with heavy themes and a pinch of metroidvania spatial reasoning across time is my absolute bane and i still found it worth powering through my only complaint is that completing the game effectively closes your save file having it start at the credits so seeing all the possible endings at least 2 exist requires playing through it all again as would using your fully completed map to run around and grab the secret achievements

a beautiful puzzleplatformer that expertly blends challenging puzzles with thought provoking story its core mechanic cloning and swapping to said clones provides an excellent framework for puzzles ranging from simple to mind bending with a well paced difficulty curve  great gameplay great visuals great soundtrack great plot a real gem
good atmosphere plays well on steam deck
it is a great science fiction puzzle game that raises some interesting ethical questions

really excellent puzzle game with a great mechanic doesnt stick around too long worth playing through twice just to see both endings and find all the secrets the story is solid enough with par voice acting honestly what it does best is setting a vibe weird line reads aside definitely recommend this game to any puzzlestory fan

the swapper is easily recommended its a puzzle game where you use swap virtual clones of yourself and transport though them while keeping the movement consistent between all of them the goal is to open gates get points to open new areas the atmosphere is phenomenal also big respect for the developers for caring for the game releasing patches often we need more games like this 1010

short and nice puzzle experience the setting is evocative most of the puzzles pose an approachable challenge but 2 or 3 are really evil and require some precision platforming the story is cryptic not the main hook of the game in my opinion yet interesting enough i would have loved a sequel or a dlc the main mechanics is really cool and it is worth exploring more

great concept and the puzzles are fair and well thought out there were 3 puzzles that i had to leave and come back to at the end but never ran into anything frustrating shout out to the review saying you have to be a genius to beat in 5 hours without a walkthrough i feel like theyre flirting with me

the swapper is a game where you create clones of yourself and swap hence the title your consciousness between them  you may think thats a rather horrifying concept for a game with a claymation style aesthetic and the game developers would agree with you  man that endings dark  so if youre up for a game with an unique visual style that makes full use of its concept both in the puzzles and the narrative than swappers your game
